project.teaser: BEAMING aims to raise excellence by enhancing innovation and knowledge valorisation within the bioeconomy domain through cooperation between higher education institutions, with a particular focus on Widening countries in Central-Eastern (CEE) and South-Eastern European (SEE)...
project.objective: BEAMING aims to raise excellence by enhancing innovation and knowledge valorisation within the bioeconomy domain through cooperation between higher education institutions, with a particular focus on Widening countries in Central-Eastern (CEE) and South-Eastern European (SEE) EU Member States and the Western Balkans. Improved global competitiveness and visibility of higher education institutions (HEI) will be achieved through establishing effective technology and know-how transfer between Widening countries and EU14 member states with more developed bioeconomies and R&I ecosystems, exploring and adopting structural reforms, educational priorities, and a culture of excellence. The BEAMING Alliance works towards 7 Specific Objectives: 1) Build the capacity of early-career researchers in all aspects of bioeconomy research; 2) Facilitate the reform of institutional practices and policy frameworks towards excellence; 3) Foster networking, knowledge exchange, and cross-disciplinary collaboration by establishing sustainable Communities of Practice; 4) Design joint research and innovation strategies and launch joint research projects; 5) Design a complex portfolio of activities for adopting Open Science practices; 6) Strengthen the valorisation of research results by increasing tech transfer capacity; 7) Support the participating institutions to move towards inclusive institutional culture, including gender equality. We aim to foster the uptake of the Quadruple Helix innovation ecosystem approach to provide a framework for higher education institutions to work collaboratively with industry, government, and civil society. Thereby, we aim to enhance their innovation capacity and the applicability of research results. Local and regional implementation strategies and roadmaps will be developed regarding the relevant ERA Policy Agenda actions in the higher education sector, particularly in the domains of bioeconomy and circular economy.
project.title: BIOECONOMY EXCELLENCE ALLIANCE FOR STIMULATING INNOVATIVE AND INCLUSIVE GREEN TRANSITION

result.title: Report on bioeconomy Quadruple Helix innovation ecosystems
result.description: The report identifies the needs and priorities of QH stakeholders so that bioeconomy research and education activities performed by HEIs can be aligned with them.

result.title: Report on institutional practices in bioeconomy research
result.description: The report provides a comprehensive review of institutional research policies, procedures, and practices will be performed, with a particular focus on bioeconomy-related research with tangible societal and economic impact.

result.title: Report on capacity building in bioeconomy research
result.description: The report details the Bioeconomy Research training program (adoptable by the relevant tasks in WPs 7-9 to be tailored to their respective scopes) developed based on the training needs of researchers around topics at the core of bioeconomy research (e.g., agricultural sciences, industrial biotechnology, materials science, bioeconomics, policy).

result.title: BEAMING Project Management Handbook
result.description: The BEAMING Project Management Handbook gives an overview of the most relevant coordination and monitoring aspects of the project, setting the rules and responsibilities of the partners aimed at ensuring a good quality and progress of the work.

result.title: Report on the first phase of Alliance-building
result.description: The document reports on the initial phase of implementing the 1st Strategic Roadmap: monitoring progress, debating directions within the consortium, and engaging key stakeholders to maximize impact.

result.title: BEAMING Open Science Case Study Book
result.description: The findings of a series of case studies conducted on the Open Science practices of the 12 BEAMING partner HEI and research institutes, including roadmaps to successful implementation, will be summarized in the BEAMING Open Science Case Study Book.

result.title: Updated BEAMING Project Management Handbook
result.description: The Updated BEAMING Project Management Handbook improves on the first version of the document, based on the conclusions drawn during the first 16 months of the project, providing an overview of the most relevant coordination and monitoring aspects.

result.title: Project visual identity
result.description: The visual identity and logo of the project, used in templates, leaflets, flyers, infographics,fact-sheets and presentations, designed to support project communication and branding.

result.title: BEAMING CDEP
result.description: The Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan (CDEP) contains the strategies and activities to maximize the impact of the project, defining concrete tasks, responsible partners and timelines for these activities, channels identified as adequate, key performance indicators to monitor progress, and exploitation routes for the results generated.

result.title: Project Website and Social/Digital Media Channels
result.description: The website together with the social/digital media channels (Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.) will be kept as a central ‘living’ virtual hub for project activities and will contribute to creating ‘communities of support’ to the project.

result.title: Clustering workshop
result.description: The workshop provides training on clustering activities to 1 responsible person appointed by each BEAMING partner to promote networking with other projects will ensure knowledge interchange and reuse between previous and future projects.

result.title: Collection of individual Open Science Action Plans
result.description: The report contains the individual Open Science Action Plans tailored to the needs of each BEAMING HEI Partner, with actionable insights towards improving institutional regulatory frameworks, standard operating procedures, as well as unofficial practices.

result.title: Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: The DMP outlines how data generated or collected during the course of the BEAMING project will be handled, documented, stored, shared, and preserved.

result.title: Report on Open Science capacity building and mobility activities
result.description: The report gives an overview of all capacity-building and mobility-based activities in WP7, including the evaluation of their impact and effectiveness.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - BEAMING (BIOECONOMY EXCELLENCE ALLIANCE FOR STIMULATING INNOVATIVE AND INCLUSIVE GREEN TRANSITION)
result.teaser: The BEAMING project addresses persistent disparities in research and innovation (R&I) capacity across Europe by strengthening bioeconomy research excellence in Widening Countries—specifically in Central and Southeastern Europe, including the Western Balkans. Despite...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: BEAMING Consortium at in-person kick-off meeting in Budapest

result.title: Guidelines for launching and operating BEAMING CoPs
result.description: Launching CoPs intends to facilitate knowledge exchange, collaboration, and networking among students, researchers, faculty members, as well as external bioeconomy stakeholders. The guidelines will provide useful tips on establishing communication channels, organizing regular events, and providing support and resources to create a vibrant community of peers who are working towards a common goal of advancing bioeconomy research.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
